posts.content:
GA2 - Deployment Tools - Discussion Thread [TDS Jan 2025] Tools in Data Science


    We have removed that button, cause it was causing confusion among the students. 
If you have saved your answers on the TDS portal then you need not worry, you will be marked. The button was just there to ensure you saw the assignment on the TDS portal. 
Regards, 
TDS TA
  

Read this
I saved that too but right now scores of GA2 isn’t visible for me. And in score section it’s showing assignment not submitted. @Saransh_Saini

Your scores are evaluated on a site that is external to the seek portal and is not integrated with the seek portal. Therefore seek does not know if you have submitted or not and by default says that it has not been submitted because it cannot see your external evaluation. There will not be a fix for this for some time.
Scores for GA1, GA2, GA3, GA4, GA5, Project1, Project2, ROE will NOT be inside your seek portal.
The scores will only be visible in the dashboard. Just ignore anything inside seek portal. The dashboard is where all your subject score cards exists.
As stated in multiple places on discourse as well as in live sessions, The final score is always your last submission. If your dashboard score does not match your final submission score on the assignment page, only then contact us regarding your marks.
Kind regards

@Jivraj @iamprasna  i have taken tds in this term. after the first assignment there was no checkbox provided to any graded assignment .for this reason i just saved the assignment at the portal link .and now after the deadline its showing my assignment  had not been submitted. pls do something please do it fast.

@23f3002530
Please refer to this post.

posts.image_description:
Here's a precise description of the image, including highlighted sections and their significance:

**Overview**

The image is a screenshot of a web page, specifically from an online graded assignment platform.  It shows the end of an assignment and some associated instructions.

**Key Parameters & Topics**

*   **Assignment Details:**
    *   Title: Graded Assignment 3: ITM.
    *   Course: TDS 2025 Jan GA3 - Large Language Models.
    *   End Date/Time: Wed, 5 Feb, 2025, 11:59 pm IST.
    *   Score: 0.
    *   URL: exam.sanand.workers.dev/tds-2025-01-ga3

*   **User Information:**
    *   Logged in as: 23f3004066@ds.study.iitm.ac.in.
    *   Logout option available.

*   **Recent Saves:** Displays recent saves with timestamps and scores (all showing a score of 8).

*   **Important Instructions/Notes**
    *   Browser may struggle.
    *   Use anything for assistance.
    *   The platform is hackable.
    *   Multiple servers are running simultaneously.

**Highlighted Sections and Significance**

1.  **Red Bar with End Date/Time and Score:**  The red bar at the top is used to emphasize the assignment deadline and the current score. The red color indicates that the assignment has ended.
2.  **Instructions (Items 5, 6, 7 and the 'Note'):** These are highlighted to draw attention to important information about the assignment environment, acceptable resources, and unusual aspects (like the platform being intentionally hackable).
3.  **"Have questions? Join the discussion on Discourse":** This section is highlighted as a call to action, encouraging students to seek help or engage in discussion on the Discourse platform. The bright color of the banner stands out to attract attention.
4.  **Recent Saves:** This list of recent saves is emphasized with its own teal background, allowing the user to quickly review their work.

**Overall Impression**

The interface is designed to be informative.  The instructions are quite unconventional, explicitly stating that it's acceptable (and perhaps expected) to use any available resources, including hacking the platform, to find solutions. This suggests a more open-ended, experimental assignment design.

posts.image_description:
Here's a concise description of the image, including highlighted elements and their significance:

**Overview:** The image depicts a web interface, likely for an online quiz or assessment.  It presents instructions, options to check and save progress, and displays recent saves.

**Key Elements and Highlights:**

*   **"Ended at Wed, 5 Feb, 2025, 11:59 pm IST":**  This indicates the deadline for the quiz or assessment. The red background emphasizes the urgency or the fact that the time is up.
*   **"Score: 0":** The current score is prominently displayed. It's likely highlighted to draw the user's attention to their performance.
*   **"Check all" and "Save":** Buttons for checking answers and saving progress. These are crucial for the user's interaction with the quiz, so they are emphasized.
*   **Numbered Instructions (1-7):** Outlines rules and guidelines for the quiz. These instructions cover topics like using resources, saving answers, and even the possibility of hacking the quiz. The fact that "hacking" is allowed is a noteworthy and unconventional instruction.
*   **"Check" and "Save" (within instruction text):**  These are highlighted (likely with a different font style or color) to correspond with the "Check all" and "Save" buttons, reinforcing their importance.
*   **"Have questions? Join the discussion on Discourse":** This is a call to action, guiding the user to a forum or discussion platform for assistance. It indicates the availability of support or community interaction.
*   **"Recent saves (most recent is your official score)":** Shows a history of the user's saved progress, including timestamps and scores. This allows the user to potentially revert to earlier saves if needed.
*   **Logged-in user:**  The user's email address `@ds.study.iitm.ac.in` is displayed, indicating they are logged into the system.

**Overall Impression:** The interface is designed to be relatively permissive (allowing the use of external resources and even hinting at the quiz being hackable). It emphasizes regular saving, score tracking, and provides a means for users to seek help through a discussion platform. The ending time and score are prominently displayed to keep the user informed about their progress and the deadline.

Tds: assignment is not submitting Tools in Data Science


    Scores for GA1, GA2, GA3, GA4, GA5, Project1, Project2, ROE will NOT be inside your seek portal. 
The scores will only be visible in the dashboard. Just ignore anything inside the seek portal. 
As stated in multiple places in discourse as well as in live sessions, The final score is always your last submission. 
Kind regards
Only 1st Graded assignment scores are visible on dashboard.  I have submitted 2nd and 3rd GA before the deadline but still it showing “not submitted” on the seek portal…

I recently got mail and checked my marks for GA2 and noticed that the final score is showing as 4.25, but while attempting the assignment earlier, I had scored 7.25 shown after submission.
Could you please help me understand how the marks were reduced? I want to ensure there was no error or misunderstanding in the evaluation.

Hi Satish,
Your last submitted score is the only valid score. You have to check before submitting that the score is correct. There is a reload button to load previous answers. But some answers require a live service. If the live service is not running at the time of the check (when you hit the submit button), you will not be scored for those questions. Please make sure that you have any live services running when the submit button is used and check that the last saved score is correct.
Kind regards
